subject: Problem with Junit/HttpUnit
msgSnippet: I am having a problem running HttpUnit through junit.swingui.TestRunner. ... import junit.framework.TestCase; import com.meterware.httpunit.*; public class
messageBody:
I am having a problem running HttpUnit through junit.swingui.TestRunner.
When I run this TestCase:

-----
import junit.framework.TestCase;
import com.meterware.httpunit.*;

public class ReadPageTest extends TestCase
{
public ReadPageTest( String name )
{
super( name );
}

public void testReadingRequestPage( ) throws Exception
{
WebConversation wc = new WebConversation( );
WebRequest request = new GetMethodWebRequest(
"http://127.0.0.1/index.html" );
WebResponse response = wc.getResponse( request );
assertNotNull( response );
}

public static void main( String args[ ] )
{
junit.textui.TestRunner.run( ReadPageTest.class );
}
}
-----

through the swingui or awtui TestRunner, I get this exception:

java.lang.IllegalAccessError: try to access field
org.w3c.tidy.ParserImpl._parseHead from class
org.w3c.tidy.ParserImpl$ParseHTML

The strange thing is that this works just fine through the
textui.TestRunner. Same classpath is used for both invocations. It also
works fine if I parse index.html directly with TinyJ.

As far as I know, I'm using the most recent versions of all tools off
sourceforge.org. Any ideas?

bab

----
